The virus known as SARS-CoV-2, which causes the disease COVID-19, has caused a global pandemic in a few short months.
1 As of March 29, 2020, there have been over 634,885 confirmed cases globally, and over 29,997 reported deaths worldwide. Although the virus primarily presents as a lower respiratory tract infection and is transmitted via respiratory droplets, there are multiple gastrointestinal and hepatic manifestations of the disease. This brief review summarizes the available limited data on digestive manifestations of COVID-19.
